tripleplay.ui.Elements

Packages that use Elements

Uses of Elements in tripleplay.ui
 

Classes in tripleplay.ui with type parameters of type Elements
 class Elements<T extends Elements<T>>
          Contains other elements and lays them out according to a layout policy.
 

Subclasses of Elements in tripleplay.ui
 class Group
          A grouping element that contains other elements and lays them out according to a layout policy.
 class Menu
          Holds a collection of MenuItems, dispatching a Menu.itemTriggered() signal when one is selected and triggered.
 class Root
          The root of a display hierarchy.
 class Scroller
          A composite element that manages horizontal and vertical scrolling of a single content element.
 class SizableGroup
          A group that allows configuring its preferred size.
 class Tabs
          A composite Elements that implements tabbing.
 

Methods in tripleplay.ui that return Elements
 Elements<?> Element.parent()
          Returns the parent of this element, or null.
 

Methods in tripleplay.ui with parameters of type Elements
 Selector Selector.add(Elements<?> elements)
          Tracks the children of elements for setting the selection.
abstract  pythagoras.f.Dimension Layout.computeSize(Elements<?> elems, float hintX, float hintY)
          Computes and returns the size needed to arrange children of the supplied elements according to their preferred size, given the specified x and y size hints.
abstract  void Layout.layout(Elements<?> elems, float left, float top, float width, float height)
          Lays out the supplied elements into a region of the specified dimensions.
 Selector Selector.remove(Elements<?> elements)
          Stops tracking the children of elements for setting the selection.
 

Constructors in tripleplay.ui with parameters of type Elements
MenuHost(Interface iface, Elements<?> root)
          Creates a menu host using the given values.
Selector(Elements<?> elements, Element<?> initialSelection)
          Creates a selector containing the children of elements with initialSelection selected.
